title.narrative: EQUITABLE ACCESS TO INCLUSIVE, QUALITY EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2023, children have increased equitable access to inclusive quality preschool and fundamental education., which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more preschool and school aged children benefit from an equitable, inclusive, quality education and acquire the necessary skills to continue their education or integrate into the labour market

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, children have increased equitable access to inclusive quality preschool and fundamental education.

description.narrative: In 2019, 100,792 children (51,404 girls), including returnees, (IDPs) and from poorer households were reintegrated and/or maintained in the education system, one third of them in emergency situations. 22 preschool classrooms were rehabilited and constructed and complemented by provision of learning materials. Capacity-building of 256 teachers contributed to increased quality of preschool education for 13,000 children (6,630 girls). This is the result of a partnership with the (MoE), NGOs: War Child Holland, ODEDIM, Jesuit Refugee Services and AVSI. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2020
